channel.title: How do you make a button open a webpage. DONE! FINALLY!
channel.description:
Welp, my question got answered, a mod may lock this.
and if your wondering, it looks like this [IMG]http://i13.tinypic.com/4zjky93.jpg[/img]
it was for my sister and she loves it. It links her to her favorite games.. i doubt anyone on here plays these games so no point ins uploading.
Thanks, pwnd, lawl, yakman, and taharok!

item.title: How do you make a button open a webpage. DONE! FINALLY!
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

White Castle:

Seriously, you need to start on something MUCH SIMPLER if you don’t know what a class body is.

its already there

i got the first button working. when i added the code to the rest it did this.
public static void main(String[] args)
{
new HelloFrame();
}

public HelloFrame()
{		
	this.setSize(400,300);		
   this.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);	   
	this.setTitle("Games!");		
	
	JButton button1 = new JButton("Webkinz");		
	JButton button2 = new JButton("Whyville");
	JButton button3 = new JButton("Zwinky");
	JButton button4 = new JButton("MillsBerry");
	JButton button5 = new JButton("ClubPenguin");
	button1.addActionListener(this);
	
	JLabel label1 = new JLabel("Choose a game you would like to go to. Then you will go there.");
	JPanel panel1 = new JPanel();		
	panel1.setLayout(new FlowLayout(FlowLayout.CENTER));		
	panel1.add(label1);
	this.add(panel1);		
	this.add(button1);		
	this.add(button2);
	this.add(button3);
	this.add(button4);
	this.add(button5);		
	this.setLayout(null);		
	button2.setBounds(5, 5, 150, 50);
	button1.setBounds( (getWidth()-100)/2, (getHeight()-30)/2, 100, 30 );		
	setLayout(null);		
	setLayout(new FlowLayout());		
	add(button1, FlowLayout.CENTER);
	this.setVisible(true);
}

right there ^^ that one, thats what this pic is of, its already there but its not saying that.

item.title: How do you make a button open a webpage. DONE! FINALLY!
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

GOT IT! THANKS! SO MUCH! it turns out that was ALL i needed, ecxept for the getruntime thing

THANKS![br][size=1]Posted on: June 05, 2007, 03:56:13 PM[/size][hr]ok now its being gay and says… i tried to do what it says but im confused.

i have this

package JFrame;

import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.FlowLayout;
import java.awt.event.*;
import java.awt.*;

public class HelloFrame extends JFrame implements ActionListener
{
	public static void main(String[] args)
	{
		new HelloFrame();		
	}
	
	public HelloFrame()
	{		
		this.setSize(400,300);		
	   this.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);	   
		this.setTitle("Games!");		
		
		JButton button1 = new JButton("Webkinz");		
		JButton button2 = new JButton("Whyville");
		JButton button3 = new JButton("Zwinky");
		JButton button4 = new JButton("MillsBerry");
		JButton button5 = new JButton("ClubPenguin");
		button1.addActionListener(this);
		
		JLabel label1 = new JLabel("Choose a game you would like to go to. Then you will go there.");
		JPanel panel1 = new JPanel();		
		panel1.setLayout(new FlowLayout(FlowLayout.CENTER));		
		panel1.add(label1);
		this.add(panel1);		
		this.add(button1);		
		this.add(button2);
		this.add(button3);
		this.add(button4);
		this.add(button5);		
		this.setLayout(null);		
		button2.setBounds(5, 5, 150, 50);
		button1.setBounds( (getWidth()-100)/2, (getHeight()-30)/2, 100, 30 );		
		setLayout(null);		
		setLayout(new FlowLayout());		
		add(button1, FlowLayout.CENTER);
		this.setVisible(true);
	}


		
		public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt) {
	         String cmd = evt.getActionCommand();
	         if(cmd.equals("Webkinz")) {
	        	 try {
	        		 Runtime.getRuntime().exec("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler http://www.webkinz.com");
	        		} catch (Exception e) {}
	        		
	        		if(cmd.equals("Whyville")) {
	   	        	 try {
	   	        		 Runtime.getRuntime().exec("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler http://www.whyville.com");
	   	        		} catch (Exception e) {}
	   	        		
	   	        		if(cmd.equals("Zwinky")) {
	   		        	 try {
	   		        		 Runtime.getRuntime().exec("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler http://www.zwinky.com");
	   		        		} catch (Exception e) {}
	   		        		
	   		        		if(cmd.equals("Millsberry")) {
	   			        	 try {
	   			        		 Runtime.getRuntime().exec("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler http://www.millsberry.com");
	   			        		} catch (Exception e) {}
	   			        		
	   			        		if(cmd.equals("ClubPenguin")) {
	   				        	 try {
	   				        		 Runtime.getRuntime().exec("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler http://www.clubpenguin.com");
	   				        		} catch (Exception e) {}	   			        		
	
	}
}

@yakman wrote:

Frell:

how did you get it to let it say “button1.addActionListener(this);”?

he put ‘implements ActionListener’ at the top
that makes it so the class is an instance of ActionListener, you could say it ‘becomes’ an action listener.

item.title: How do you make a button open a webpage. DONE! FINALLY!
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Sigh, try this:

import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.event.*;
import java.awt.*;

public class HelloFrame extends JFrame implements ActionListener
{
	public static void main(String[] args)
	{
		new HelloFrame();
	}

	public HelloFrame()
	{
		this.setSize(400, 300);
		this.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
		this.setTitle("Games!");

		JButton button1 = new JButton("Webkinz");
		JButton button2 = new JButton("Whyville");
		JButton button3 = new JButton("Zwinky");
		JButton button4 = new JButton("MillsBerry");
		JButton button5 = new JButton("ClubPenguin");
		button1.addActionListener(this);
		button2.addActionListener(this);
		button3.addActionListener(this);
		button4.addActionListener(this);
		button5.addActionListener(this);

		JLabel label1 = new JLabel("Choose a game you would like to go to. Then you will go there.");
		JPanel panel1 = new JPanel();
		panel1.setLayout(new FlowLayout(FlowLayout.CENTER));
		panel1.add(label1);
		this.add(panel1);
		this.add(button1);
		this.add(button2);
		this.add(button3);
		this.add(button4);
		this.add(button5);
		this.setLayout(null);
		button2.setBounds(5, 5, 150, 50);
		button1.setBounds((getWidth() - 100) / 2, (getHeight() - 30) / 2, 100, 30);
		setLayout(null);
		setLayout(new FlowLayout());
		add(button1, FlowLayout.CENTER);
		this.setVisible(true);
	}

	public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
	{
		if (e.getSource().equals(button1))
		{
			try
			{
				Runtime.getRuntime().exec("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler http://www.webkinz.com");
			}
			catch (Exception e) { }
		}
		else if (e.getSource().equals(button2))
			System.out.println("button 2 pressed");
		else if (e.getSource().equals(button3))
			System.out.println("button 3 pressed");
		else if (e.getSource().equals(button4))
			System.out.println("button 4 pressed");
		else if (e.getSource().equals(button5))
			System.out.println("button 5 pressed");
	}
}

Please read the edits I made and try to remember them.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Frell wrote:

ok, i have this. no errors but when i press webkinz nothing happens.

package JFrame;

import javax.swing.*;
import java.awt.FlowLayout;
import java.awt.event.*;
import java.awt.*;

public class HelloFrame extends JFrame
{
	public static void main(String[] args)
	{
		new HelloFrame();		
	}
	
	public HelloFrame()
	{		
		this.setSize(400,300);		
	   this.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);	   
		this.setTitle("Games!");		
		
		JButton button1 = new JButton("Webkinz");
		JButton button2 = new JButton("Whyville");
		JButton button3 = new JButton("Zwinky");
		JButton button4 = new JButton("MillsBerry");
		JButton button5 = new JButton("ClubPenguin");
		
		JLabel label1 = new JLabel("Choose a game you would like to go to. Then you will go there.");
		JPanel panel1 = new JPanel();		
		panel1.setLayout(new FlowLayout(FlowLayout.CENTER));		
		panel1.add(label1);
		this.add(panel1);		
		this.add(button1);
		this.add(button2);
		this.add(button3);
		this.add(button4);
		this.add(button5);		
		this.setLayout(null);		
		button2.setBounds(5, 5, 150, 50);
		button1.setBounds( (getWidth()-100)/2, (getHeight()-30)/2, 100, 30 );		
		setLayout(null);		
		setLayout(new FlowLayout());		
		add(button1, FlowLayout.CENTER);
		this.setVisible(true);
	}
		
		public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt) {
	         String cmd = evt.getActionCommand();
	         if(cmd.equals("Webkinz")) {
	        	 try {
	        		 Runtime.getRuntime().exec("rundll32 url.dll,FileProtocolHandler http://www.webkinz.com");
	        		} catch (Exception e) {}
	         }
	         if(cmd.equals("Whyville")) {
	                  //hnjykul
	         }		
	
	}
}

item.title: How do you make a button open a webpage. DONE! FINALLY!
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

in you class, make it implement ActionListener
first add import java.awt.event.*; to the top of your file

public class MyClass implements ActionListener {

somewhere in your class, put this method

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt) { }

in other methods, you (the programmer) calls them, but for this one the system call it when someone presses the button
by writing whats in that method, you prepair a responce

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt) { System.out.println("hello, you've pressed a button i see"); }

for every one of your buttons, put

myButton.addActionListener(this);

you need a way to tell which button was pressed, do it like this…

String cmd = evt.getActionCommand();

now the string called cmd, contains the text the button shows eg. “club penguin”

so your method would look something like this…

public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent evt) { String cmd = evt.getActionCommand(); if(cmd.equals("Webkinz")) { //open webkinz } if(cmd.equals("Whyville")) { //open whyville }

Read full topic
